meanings.definition: Having or showing very strict moral attitudes
meanings.sent1: The straitlaced teacher disapproved of any form of joking in class.
meanings.sent2: She always followed the rules and was known for her straitlaced behavior.
meanings.sent3: The straitlaced librarian raised an eyebrow at the loud teenagers in the library.
meanings.sent4: His straitlaced views on relationships made it hard for him to understand modern dating.
meanings.sent5: The town's straitlaced reputation kept many from engaging in any questionable activities.

meanings.sent1: The party had a strict dress code, attracting only the straitlaced attendees.
meanings.sent2: Her upbringing in a traditional household made her quite straitlaced in her approach to life.
meanings.sent3: The straitlaced businessman was surprised by the casual attire at the company retreat.
meanings.sent4: In a world of changing norms, she remained straitlaced in her values.
meanings.sent5: The novel's protagonist was portrayed as straitlaced, always following societal expectations.
